New Records: Mohammed Shami's 7/57 is the best bowling figure in a World Cup semi-final.
Key Match Events: Mohammed Shami took 7 wickets for 57 runs.
Daryl Mitchell scored 134 off 119 balls for New Zealand.
Pre-Game Insights: India elected to bat first after winning the toss.
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammed Shami was named Player of the Match.
India advanced to the final of the ICC Cricket World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.
New Zealand were all out for 327 in 48.5 overs.
